lead_paragraph: As the automaker defended the safety of its Model S, its request for confidentiality in exchange for repairs raised questions among legal experts.

byline.original: By NEAL E. BOUDETTE and ANNALYN KURTZ

headline.print_headline: Tesla Owner’s Lost Wheel Was Just the First Surprise
headline.main: For Tesla Owner, Losing a Wheel Was Just the First Surprise

snippet: As the automaker defended the safety of its Model S, its request for confidentiality in exchange for repairs raised questions among legal experts.
abstract: Tesla acknowledges that its unusual practice of asking car owners to sign nondisclosure agreements after repairing their vehicles at little or no charge is part of effort to protect itself from lawsuits; legal experts dispute practice, saying it could stop drivers from reporting safety problems to National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.
